alert.note: Alert for Covington; Forrest; Jefferson Davis; Jones; Lamar (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:24PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Forrest, southern Covington, northern Lamar, southwestern Jones and southeastern Jefferson Davis Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 323 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bassfield, or 8 miles southwest of Collins, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Collins and Melba around 330 PM CDT. Seminary around 340 PM CDT. Sumrall around 345 PM CDT. Sanford around 355 PM CDT. Rawls Springs around 405 PM CDT. Moselle and Eastabuchie around 410 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Covington; Forrest; Jefferson Davis; Jones; Lamar
